Operation 'ondemandscanning.projects.locations.operations.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about what 'delete' means in this context (removal from tracking, not cancellation). Added clarification that this is a cleanup operation and what the expected response is, improving AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Deletes a long-running operation. This method indicates that the client is no longer interested in the operation result. It does not cancel the operation. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`.
data.description_suggestion: Removes a long-running operation from the system. This method indicates that the client is no longer interested in the operation result and removes it from tracking. Note: This does not cancel the underlying operation if it is still running. Returns an empty response on success. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about what 'delete' means in this context (removal from tracking, not cancellation). Added clarification that this is a cleanup operation and what the expected response is, improving AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Gets the latest state of a long-running operation. Clients can use this method to poll the operation result at intervals as recommended by the API service.
data.summary_suggestion: Get the current state of an operation
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the latest state of a long-running operation, including its progress, status, and any results or errors. Clients can use this method to poll the operation result at intervals as recommended by the API service. Returns an Operation object containing the current state and metadata.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks information about what is returned (Operation object with status, progress, results). Added clarity about return value to help AI agents understand what data they will receive.

message: Operation 'ondemandscanning.projects.locations.operations.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is too vague about what filters are supported and what is returned. Added details about filtering capabilities, pagination, and return type to improve AI agent interpretability for operation discovery and monitoring scenarios.

data.current_description: Lists operations that match the specified filter in the request. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `UNIMPLEMENTED`.
data.description_suggestion: Lists all long-running operations in the specified location that match the provided filter criteria. Supports filtering by operation status, name patterns, and other attributes. Returns a paginated list of Operation objects. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is too vague about what filters are supported and what is returned. Added details about filtering capabilities, pagination, and return type to improve AI agent interpretability for operation discovery and monitoring scenarios.

message: Operation 'ondemandscanning.projects.locations.operations.wait' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description is detailed but could be clearer about the timeout parameter behavior and the best-effort nature. Reorganized for better clarity about what the operation does and its limitations for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Waits until the specified long-running operation is done or reaches at most a specified timeout, returning the latest state. If the operation is already done, the latest state is immediately returned. If the timeout specified is greater than the default HTTP/RPC timeout, the HTTP/RPC timeout is used. If the server does not support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Note that this method is on a best-effort basis. It may return the latest state before the specified timeout (including immediately), meaning even an immediate response is no guarantee that the operation is done.
data.summary_suggestion: Wait for a long-running operation to complete
data.description_suggestion: Blocks until the specified long-running operation completes or reaches the specified timeout, whichever comes first. Returns the latest Operation state immediately if already done. The timeout parameter controls the maximum wait duration; if it exceeds the default HTTP/RPC timeout, the HTTP/RPC timeout is used instead. Note: This is a best-effort method and may return before the timeout expires. An immediate response does not guarantee the operation is complete. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is detailed but could be clearer about the timeout parameter behavior and the best-effort nature. Reorganized for better clarity about what the operation does and its limitations for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ondemandscanning.projects.locations.scans.analyzePackages' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description is too vague about what 'analysis' means in this domain (vulnerability scanning), what inputs are expected, what is returned (Operation object), and how to access results. Added domain context about vulnerability scanning, asynchronous nature, and how to retrieve results for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Initiates an analysis of the provided packages.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous vulnerability analysis of the provided packages. Accepts a list of packages to analyze and returns a long-running Operation object. The operation completes when the vulnerability scan is finished. Use Operations.GetOperation or Operations.Wait to monitor progress and retrieve results. Scan results can be retrieved using the vulnerabilities.list operation once the scan completes.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is too vague about what 'analysis' means in this domain (vulnerability scanning), what inputs are expected, what is returned (Operation object), and how to access results. Added domain context about vulnerability scanning, asynchronous nature, and how to retrieve results for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ondemandscanning.projects.locations.scans.vulnerabilities.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description lacks context about prerequisites (scan must be completed), what data is returned (vulnerability details, severity, affected packages), and how to identify which scan's results to retrieve. Added clarity about operation prerequisites and return data structure for AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Lists vulnerabilities resulting from a successfully completed scan.
data.summary_suggestion: List vulnerabilities from a completed scan
data.description_suggestion: Lists all vulnerabilities discovered in a successfully completed scan. Returns a paginated list of vulnerability findings including severity, affected packages, and remediation information. This operation should only be called after a scan operation has completed successfully. Use the scan ID or parent resource identifier to filter results.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks context about prerequisites (scan must be completed), what data is returned (vulnerability details, severity, affected packages), and how to identify which scan's results to retrieve. Added clarity about operation prerequisites and return data structure for AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.
